meanings.definition: Not chosen by vote or appointment
meanings.sent1: The unelected committee members were selected randomly.
meanings.sent2: The unelected officials were not voted into their positions.
meanings.sent3: It was quite a surprise to see the unelected janitor leading the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The unelected leader emerged from the shadows, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent5: The image of the unelected council member wearing a crown stuck in my mind.

meanings.sent1: The unelected candidate did not campaign for the role.
meanings.sent2: She was an unelected member of the board, but still had influence.
meanings.sent3: The unelected chef whipped up a delicious meal for the event.
meanings.sent4: Her unelected status did not diminish her authority in the company.
meanings.sent5: The unelected senator's voice carried weight in the debate.
